history.text: Hey!  Just saw an excellent film, Maleficent, starring Angelina Jolie.  Have you seen it?
I haven't
is it good?
It doesn't have a gret rating on Rotten Tomatoes, but CinemaScore gave it an A
Well, the important thing is that you liked it, versus what the critics said
IT was pretty good, yes... It was based on a fairy tale, by Charles Perrault
it seems to have an interesting plot
and Angelina Jolie seems like a good fit for the role
Well, the story comes from the POV of her character and it's quite unexpected
I think that's quite brilliant
i'm sick of fairy tales that depict in all good or all bad.  real life isn't like that
Oh yes, the depiction of her relationship with Aurora, the princess, really sets it apart...
Can you elaborate on that?
I mean the plot was pretty dark... but it starts with Malefecents first love, stefan
he betrays her to the king and it makes her turn the moors into a foreboding place
She gets a Raven servant that she transforms into different beings as needed and pretty much retreats into her darkness
Angelina is perfect for a dark role
It's true.  Even critics that didn't like it say she was the highlight of the film
I mean I understand the characters darkness too... Stefan betrays her by cutting off her wings with iron... that's pretty mercenary
Stefan is played by Sharito Copley... and Aurora by Elle Fanning
I'm glad to see Angelina getting praise for a role
wow i like the dark edge
Oh sure, and well deserved.  Maleficent watches over Aurora from afar... and she really portrays that kindness under the bitter
Aurora's innocent 'mistake' of calling Maleficent her 'fairy godmother' makes her want to undo the curse on the child... but she can't... an discovers its only broken with true loves kiss
aw so its bittersweet
In a way, yes.  Maleficent sees how the pixies bumbled it up... and they do so again when they tell Aurora all about the past... making her run to her father's castle...
Angelina has that evil stepmother look
Oh yes... and the look of the film was touted by critics as part of its charm... so 'colorful' and 'bleeding edge digital design' so the look of characters and scenery was commented on
Of course when the princess gets back to the castle the third act is pretty dark too... he locks her away for 'her safety'
So basically Malicefent was a dark person because of this jerk that ruined her life
I think this the year of making the evil woman the hero...think of "I, Tonya"
The true antagonist is Stefan yes... he plots to kill her.. and of course Auroras curse finds a way to fulfill itself...
And this film was 2014... so maybe it is the decade... LOL
sure, people are getting more into complexities and injustices and understandings.  it's the zeitgeist
Fairy tales always reflect as such... this one no different... as the true love needed to break the curse was the 'motherly' love all along... not Prince Philips...
well that seems different, usually it's the prince that saves the day
someting about a stepmother dynamic, though, seems to be evil i wonder why
LOL yes, but maleficent saves Aurora and then she saves Maleficent by releasing her wings and Stefan, the real bad guy, dies... so it was pretty great LOL... Anyway, it was nice chatting about it! :)

uid2response.feedback: The other user didn't give me much.. and added things not on the 'script' but it still seemed to go well.  Good luck on your ... thing!:)
